title: Unit Circle $$1$$
text: The value inside the parenthesis of the tan refers to an angle which also corresponds to a point on the unit circle.

title: Unit Circle $$2$$
text: The angle (19𝝅/4) corresponds to more than $$2$$ revolutions around the unit circle and is equal to 2𝝅+2𝝅+3𝝅/4, thus we can continue to subtract by 2𝝅 or $$1$$ rotation until we get an angle between $$0$$ and 2𝝅 to find the corresponding value on the unit circle.

title: Unit Circle $$3$$
text: We know that the angle 3𝝅/4 corresponds to the point $$(\left(-\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}\right),\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2})$$ on the unit circle.

title: Definition of trigonometric functions
text: Letting 𝜃 be an angle, sin𝜃 $$=$$ $$y$$, cos𝜃 $$=$$ $$x$$, and tan𝜃 $$=$$ $$\frac{y}{x}$$.

title: Combining
text: Based on the above information, what is the value of tan𝜃 at the angle (19𝝅)/4.
